Intuitively, one hemisphere's fortune is likely to be the other's misfortune. As the southern hemisphere moves from summer to autumn and swiftly into winter, the transmission of all respiratory viruses will increase, including SARS-CoV-2 if introduced into that country. How can LMICs mitigate the impact of such an introduction into their health systems?

The SARS-CoV-2 outbreak is highlighting the importance of infection prevention in controlling the spread of this and other pathogens. Despite reports of the first vaccine against SARS-CoV-2 entering phase I trials (Park, 2020) , the time to rollout, should the vaccine show successful results, will not be able to mitigate the impact of a major outbreak in the southern hemisphere this winter.
